summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It covers his activities on August 9, 2019, and the discovery of his unresponsive body, medical response, and official notifications on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death is the subject of the timeline. He was found unresponsive in his cell in the SHU on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case, who was notified of his death at 10:00 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Arrived at the institution at 7:30 am on August 10, 2019, following the medical emergency.

persons.name: SIS Lt
persons.context: Notified at 7:36 am and arrived at the institution at 8:10 am on August 10, 2019, to conduct interviews.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Arrived at the institution at 8:00 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: CMC
persons.context: Notified at 8:10 am, arrived at 9:00 am, traveled to Beekman Hospital to secure Epstein's belongings, and notified Epstein's brother (next of kin).

persons.name: SCSS
persons.context: Notified at 8:10 am and arrived at the institution at 9:50 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: IDO
persons.context: Reported that Epstein was in good spirits during a social call at 7:00 pm on August 9, 2019, and later accompanied the CMC to Beekman Hospital.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Notified of Epstein's death at 9:00 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: ER Physician
persons.context: Reported the official time of death (7:20 am) at Beekman Hospital on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Inmate 85993-054
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who departed for court at 8:00 am on August 9, 2019, and did not return to the institution that night.

connections.description: Were cellmates in the SHU. The cellmate was released to court on August 9 and did not return, leaving Epstein alone in the cell.
The Case Management Coordinator was responsible for securing Epstein's belongings after death and notifying his next of kin.
The Institution Duty Officer provided Epstein with a social call on the evening of August 9 and reported he was in good spirits.
Judge Berman was the presiding judge in Epstein's case and was officially notified of his death.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day Activities
events.description: Epstein departs for attorney conferences at 8:30 am and returns to the SHU at 6:45 pm. At 7:00 pm, an IDO reports he is in good spirits during a social call. His cellmate departs for court and does not return.

events.title: Discovery of Unresponsive Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm is activated. Staff find Epstein unresponsive in his SHU cell. CPR is initiated immediately.

events.title: Medical Response and Transport
events.description: Medical staff and EMS perform CPR, apply AED, intubate, and administer epinephrine. Epstein is transported to Beekman Hospital at 7:10 am.

events.title: Official Time of Death
events.description: An ER physician at Beekman Hospital reports the official time of death as 7:20 am.

events.title: Official Notifications
events.description: A cascade of notifications occurs: Warden, AW, SIS, CMC, SCSS, FBI, AUSA, Judge Berman, and finally Epstein's brother (next of kin) are notified. A press release is issued.

events.title: Body Released for Autopsy
events.description: Epstein's body is released to the Medical Examiner (ME) for autopsy at 12:15 pm.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) / the institution (SHU - Special Housing Unit)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his SHU cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
His cellmate had been released to court the previous day (Friday, August 9) and did not return, leaving Epstein alone in the cell that night.
On the evening before his death (7:00 pm, August 9), an Institution Duty Officer reported Epstein was 'in good spirits' and 'nothing unusual' during a social call.
The official time of death was reported by an ER physician at Beekman Hospital as 7:20 am on August 10, 2019.
The body was released to the Medical Examiner for an autopsy at 12:15 pm on August 10, 2019.
